intro: Cryptodiscus rutifolius, commonly known as the red-stemmed cryptodiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Cryptodiscus rutifolius is typically found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
